comment.body: Nice to donate but ZeroNet developers should also sell some kind of license. Like donate, but getting a bill. 1 year of support, implement af new feature or áºƒhatever. Text not important. Getting a bill is important. Will make it possible for companies to support ZeroNet development.
@Militaryriotlab: Nice to see your proxy running again.
@Militaryriotlab: Yes. I have tried it a number of times without any reply and dropped it from my proxy server list. Tried it again today with success.
@Militaryriotlab: OK. I would be wrong. I have switched between 3 different comp. within a very short time. Could just have typed in the wrong address ...

The "problem" is in user_contents section of contents.json. You can make your own ID provider, but there have to be a list of ID providers in cert_signers.  https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/#user_contents
But a "unique to site" authorization could be nice as an option. Sometimes you don't need an ID provider ...
@Balancer73: I am not sure, but maybe text "Unique to site" text is misleading. Maybe it should be "Not logged in" ..
Maybe check out how Board.ZeroNetwork.bit is publishing dynamic content. No data/users structure and no user_contents section.
